speaker: Susan
content: How would you feel about me using your child support payments for plastic surgery?
mark: How would you feel about sb doing sth 询问某人对其他人做某事的感受看法
use sth for sth 使用某物来做某事；把某物用于某事
child support payments 儿童抚养费
plastic surgery 整形外科
plastic 塑料制的；人造的，不自然的； 塑料
surgery 外科手术

speaker: Julie
content: Stop being so nervous. You're just asking him out to dinner. It's no big deal.
mark: Stop being so nervous 别那么紧张了，是一个常用的祈使句，用于劝慰、安抚他人 ==  Don't be so nervous  nervous 神经紧张的，担忧的
It's no big deal 没什么大不了的；没关系；小事一桩

speaker: Susan
content: You're right. So is that your project for school? You know, when I was in fifth grade, I made the White House out of sugar cubes.
mark: in fifth grade 五年级
make sth out of sth 用…… 制作……；从…… 中制造出……
sugar cube 糖块

speaker: Julie
content: Stop stalling and go. Before Mike figures out he can do better.
mark: Stop stalling and go 别磨蹭了，走吧
stall v. 熄火，抛锚；故意拖延；暂缓，搁置，停顿； n.货摊，贩卖处，咨询台；
figure out 弄清楚，弄明白

speaker: Susan
content: Tell me again why I fought for custody of you.
mark: fight for 为……而战，而奋斗
custody 监护，监护权；监禁，拘留；保管，保护

speaker: Julie
content: You were using me to hurt Dad.

speaker: Susan
content: Oh, that's right.

speaker: Susan
content: Are you busy?

speaker: Mike
content: No, not at all. What's up?
mark: What's up? <非正式>你好，出了什么事

speaker: Susan
content: Well, I just was wondering if there was any chance that you... I just wanted to ask if... Eddie. What are you...?
mark: I was wondering if there was any chance that 询问是否有机会做某事等

speaker: Eddie
content: I was making ambrosia, And I made too much so I thought I'd bring some over to Mike. What's going on?
mark: ambrosia 特别美味的食物；神的食物
I thought I'd... = I thought I would...我原打算 / 我当时会……
bring some over to sb 带些…给某人
What's going on? 发生了什么：用于询问当前的情况或事件。

speaker: Mike
content: Susan was just going to ask me something.

speaker: Susan
content: I have a clog. And you're a plumber, right? The clog's in the pipe.

speaker: Mike
content: Yeah. That's usually where they are.

speaker: Susan
content: Well, I've got one.
mark: I've got one 我有一个

speaker: Mike
content: OK, let me get my tools.

speaker: Susan
content: Now? You want to come over now? You have company.
mark: come over 过来：指随意拜访或到访。
company 陪伴，同伴；宾客  公司
You have company 你有客人了 / 有人陪你了 / 家里来客人了

speaker: Eddie
content: I don't mind.

speaker: Mike
content: Just give me two minutes. I'll be right over.
mark: I’ll be right there. （我马上就到那里。）—— *侧重于到达那个地点。*
I’ll be right over. （我马上就过去。）—— *侧重于**移动**的动作。*right over 立刻，马上
I’m on my way. （我在路上了。）

speaker: Susan
content: That's it. Just stuff the hair down there.
mark: That's it. 就是这样；正是如此 / 够了；行了 / 完成了；结束了
stuff v. 塞进，填进；填满，装满 n. 东西，物品

speaker: Julie
content: I stuffed it. It's not enough to clog it.

speaker: Susan
content: Here, look, Put in this peanut butter and this cooking oil. And these olives.
mark: peanut butter 花生酱 peanut 花生，花生米 butter 黄油，牛油；水果酱

speaker: Julie
content: Mom, I'm telling you, it's not working.

speaker: Susan
content: Oh, god. That's him. How am I going to stop up the sink?
mark: How am I going to do sth 我该怎么样去做...
stop up the sink 堵住水槽 sink n.水槽，水池 v.下沉，沉没；这里 up= completely，就像drink up (喝光) 或 "eat up" (吃光) 一样，"stop up" 意思是 "stop completely" (彻底堵死)。

speaker: Mike
content: Well, here's your problem. Looks like somebody stuffed a bunch of popsicle sticks down here.
mark: a bunch of 一束；一串
popsicle 棒冰
stick n. 枯枝，枝条；条状物，棍状物 v.粘，贴；刺，戳，插；

speaker: Susan
content: I've told Julie a million times not to play in the kitchen. Kids, you know.
mark: a million times 一百万次
